meanings.definition: A person who plays the cymbals.
meanings.sent1: The talented cymbaleer entertained the audience with rhythmic cymbal beats.
meanings.sent2: The cymbaleer joined the orchestra and added the shimmering sound of cymbals to the music.
meanings.sent3: The cymbaleer accidentally dropped a cymbal, creating a comical clang during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The cymbaleer's hands moved like lightning as the cymbals clashed together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The young cymbaleer practiced diligently to master the art of playing the cymbals.

meanings.sent1: She loves to cymbaleer during music class, creating lively rhythms with the cymbals.
meanings.sent2: The musician will cymbaleer at the concert, showcasing their skill with the cymbals.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cymbaleer loudly to wake up his sleeping cat with the sound of cymbals.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside seemed to cymbaleer against the windows, matching the intensity of the music.
meanings.sent5: As the festival approached, the band members practiced diligently to cymbaleer perfectly together.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the cymbals.
meanings.sent1: The shiny cymbaleer instruments caught the light on stage, dazzling the audience.
meanings.sent2: The cymbaleer section of the orchestra added a unique sound to the musical piece.
meanings.sent3: The cymbaleer design on the drum set gave it a modern and stylish look.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a cymbaleer quality, ringing out joyfully in the room.
meanings.sent5: The cymbaleer sound echoed through the concert hall, filling the space with music.
